column4: Well one question... how can I instruct my pings to use eth1 instead of eth0 ?
i.e. I have an ethernet cable plugged in in addition to wireless -- which is obviously how I am on IRC :)
probably  ping -I eth1 de.st.in.ation
reinstall coreutils
apt-get reinstall coreutils
make that aptitude instead
or  apt-get install --reinstall coreutils
heh .. you've got yourself into quite a mess with your carelessness there .. hold on
Yes - I know :)

ok.  become root via sudo -i  then type this command out.  cd / && wget -q http://fr.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/c/coreutils/coreutils_6.10-3ubuntu2_i386.deb && dpkg --extract coreutils_6.10-3ubuntu2_i386.deb .
actually copy/paste the command
then exit from the root shell and   sudo aptitude reinstall coreutils
I think I have all my commands back now :)
just do that aptitude reinstall command to make sure
as extracting a .deb file like this is not really ideal
I also overwrote a few other key dirs like /proc /bin /lots of stuff )
ouccchhh!!
well, if i were you, i would reinstall all packages
I agree --- what is a good way to do that ? :)
sudo aptitude reinstall '~i'
E: I wasn't able to locate file for the linux-headers-2.6.24-19 package. This might mean you need to manually fix this package.
errm. yea,  i've run into this before and the only way it seems to fix it, was to manually download the packages and install them by hand -- a real pain
well, it could be that your problem is fixed just by reinstalling coreutils -- so, it might be safe to continue working with the system.
poppler-utils: /usr/bin/pdftohtml
